resources.string: Type in, or capture your respondent\'s answer from their voice
Create a new question or add an existing question from a list

If you continue the responses already entered will be deleted. If you want to add a probe for this question select cancel and then next. If you want to discard this respond and add a probe for the previous question, select continue.
Are you sure you want to exit the interview?
Are you sure you want to retake this response? This will delete the previous response.
Are you sure you want to remove this answer
Are you sure you want to ignore this question?
Are you sure you want to take part?
Are you sure you want the respondent to take part?
What is your relationship with the respondent?
Type in or capture audio for your answer
Try Voice-To-Text to collect your respondent\'s answers
Please select the respondent\'s age from the dropdown menu
Does your respondent require additional consent?

Your respondent requires additional consent if:

• They are not yet as old as the country's legal age of majority (recognized as adult)
• They have a disability that prevents them from giving their sole consent

Your respondent is a "beneficiary" if any of the following apply:

• They or their immediate family members have received any distribution of cash and voucher assistance (CVA) or other form of aid from the team within the last calendar year
• They have directly benefited from, or participated in, any other development or humanitarian programs led by the team in the last calendar year
What is the gender of your respondent?

Your respondent may choose "other" gender if any of the following apply:

• They are members of a recognized "third gender" in their country
• They do not identify as either a "male" or "female"
• They prefer not to identify their gender as part of their interview response
This section is about data storage and privacy

1. I will be asking you questions about your experience in the current situation. Your participation in this interview is voluntary. If at any time you wish to stop the interview, you may do so.

 2. I will be recording your responses, so that we may review them later more fully. The recording will create text – we will not save an audio file of your voice. Nothing you tell me will be personally attributable to you to anyone seeing your responses.

 3. I will also ask for your consent at the end of this interview, to confirm you are comfortable with me sharing the recordings and text we make.

 4. The data that we record and capture will be shared with our staff, in an anonymous way, to help us better understand how we can be most helpful and responsive to you and your community's needs.

 5. Because the data collected will be completely anonymous, once it is submitted at the end of the interview it cannot be specifically retrieved or deleted. I will ask you for consent again prior to submitting the data recorded.

6. Your responses will be kept online, in a secure way - they will not be publicly shared or accessible. Your responses will be confidential.

 7. If you report certain sensitive information to me, such as incidents of harm to yourself or others, I may be required to report them for further investigation, or will refer you to places where you can access support and services, if you wish.

 8. If you disclose certain unethical or illegal actions on part of the team or responding organization staff, I may be required to escalate those for investigation and review.

 If providing consent on behalf of someone else, please explain to your respondent:

 9. You are consenting to the above on behalf of your minor child, or in your capacity as caregiver for the person to be interviewed if mentally or physically disabled.
Your interview is syncing. You can move from this screen and it will continue syncing in the background.
Add a reflection or any additional information you\'d like to capture from the interview
Type, or use your voice, to capture your question

Before we start, please download the below language packs as you will need these to conduct your interviews. Language packs will allow you to capture your respondent\'s voice for their responses using Google\'s Voice to Text functionality.
Authentication failed, check your email and password or sign up

Using Speech-to-Text you can capture everything your respondent is saying without needing to type anything or risk forgetting what they are saying.

This will not keep an audio recording, but will create text on the screen of your app.

You can use this feature wherever you see the microphone icon by tapping the icon and speaking into the phone.

Make sure to hold the phone close to the respondent when they speak.

You can correct any mistakes by tapping on the text and typing using your keyboard.

You can ask your respondent a follow up question to understand more about their answer by adding a Probing question.

Add a probing question by pressing the + icon and selecting from a list of existing questions or write a new one before asking your respondent to answer.

If you want to ask a probing question for Question 1, after the respondent has answered Question 1 select 'Next'. On the screen showing Question 2, add the probing question related to Question 1.

If you think a respondent disclosed safeguarding or security concerns, you can flag the response to let researchers know.

To do this, tap on the Flag icon at the top of the screen.

If you think a respondent has said something very insightful that would be useful and interesting for data analysis, you can star the response to let researchers know.

To do this, tap on the star icon at the top of the screen.

You can only flag and star open response questions, and cannot flag or star responses to multi code or single code questions.

Before submitting the interview you will see a screen with an overview of all of the questions. This will show you which questions you have flagged, starred, skipped, and probing questions you have added.

If your respondent does not feel comfortable with their answer, you can retake the question or remove the response from this screen. You are not able to see the original answer.

You can flag or star a response on this screen if you forgot to do so in the interview.

At the end of an interview you can add reflections or additional information about the interview that you would like to share with the researchers.

To do this, press the Interview Notes icon at the bottom of the screen to add a note.

You can add the note using Speech-to-Text, or by typing.
To protect the security of your app, please create a 6-digit PIN code. This PIN will be used to access the VoiceApp during this session. When you log out of the app you will need to create a new PIN.
To protect the security of your app, please enter your 6-digit PIN code.
We just need your registered email to send you password reset instructions.
We\'ve sent you instructions, please check your email
An account with this email address does not exist
Something to know before you start

This interview includes some skip logic questions.

You don't need to do anything to make this work, just ask the questions and you will be directed to the correct place in the interview based on your respondent's answers.

For interviews with skip logic, you will not be able to delete specific answers or retake any questions at the end of the interview. On the interview overview, you may see some question numbers are skipped.
In this new version of the Voice App we have:
• VoiceApp now supports skip logic\n• Find the new VoiceApp Guide in settings, to get reminders and tips of how to use VoiceApp\'s key features.
